cardData.name: Oubliette
cardData.oracle_text: When Oubliette enters the battlefield, target creature phases out until Oubliette leaves the battlefield. Tap that creature as it phases in this way. (Auras and Equipment phase out with it. While permanents are phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist.)

cardData.name: Bog Wraith
cardData.oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cardData.flavor_text: 'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae My mate did meet an early grave 'Twas nothing left for us to save In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

cardData.name: Demonic Hordes
cardData.oracle_text:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
cardData.flavor_text: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

cardData.name: Haunting Wind
cardData.oracle_text: Whenever an artifact becomes tapped or a player activates an artifact's ability without {T} in its activation cost, Haunting Wind deals 1 damage to that artifact's controller.
cardData.flavor_text: These devices lured so many spirits that sometimes entire battlefields would become haunted at once.

cardData.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard or this attack does nothing.

cardData.flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

cardData.name: Dark Gengar

abilities.name: Deep Sleep
abilities.text: As long as any Dark Gengar are in play, a player flips 2 coins for each of his or her Pokémon that is Asleep at the end of each turn. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep. This power stops working if Dark Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pull In
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, you may choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon (before doing damage or other effects of this attack). Either way, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cardData.flavorText: It absorbs the heat in the air around it. If you suddenly feel cold, it's because a Gengar has appeared.

attacks.name: Bone Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cardData.name: Hellfire
cardData.oracle_text: Destroy all nonblack creatures. Hellfire deals X plus 3 damage to you, where X is the number of creatures that died this way.
cardData.flavor_text: "High on a throne of royal state . . . insatiate to pursue vain war with heav'n." —John Milton, *Paradise Lost*

cardData.name: Charizard ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cardData.name: Balduvian Conjurer
cardData.oracle_text: {T}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
cardData.flavor_text:
"The very lands of Balduvia are alive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
